column1: #FORMAT=WebAnno TSV 3.2
#T_SP=webanno.custom.Referent|entity|infstat
#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent
#Text=Entertain a Child on a Rainy Day
#Text=A rainy day can make it difficult to keep a child entertained all day inside but it gives for the perfect opportunity to try new activities together .
#Text=This article will provide you with a whole day of activities to keep your child engaged in fun .
#Text=We ’ll cover how to build a pillow fort , make blueberry muffins , and activities to do with friends .
#Text=Ingredients
#Text=Making Blueberry Muffins
#Text=1 cup flour
#Text=1 cup oatmeal
#Text=3 tablespoons sugar
#Text=1 teaspoon salt
#Text=4 teaspoons baking powder
#Text=1 cup blueberries , washed
#Text=1 egg
#Text=1 cup milk
#Text=¼
#Text=cup vegetable oil
#Text=Steps
#Text=Building a Pillow Fort
#Text=Ask the child you are watching to help build a pillow fort with you .
#Text=Go into a room with a couch .
#Text=This will be the room your pillow fort will be built in .
#Text=Measure the area and rearrange furniture to accommodate the potential size of your fort .
#Text=Avoid building your fort near windows , doors , and exterior walls .
#Text=Arrange two chairs about 3 feet from the couch , facing each other to make the other two corners of your fort .
#Text=These chairs will also serve as shelves in your fort .
#Text=Drape a bedsheet over the top of the chairs and the couch to provide a roof .
#Text=Make sure the long edge is covering the top of the couch backrest for a maximized space .
#Text=Lightly tug on the ends of the bed sheet to ensure it is covering all sides .
#Text=Secure the roof by holding down the ends of your blanket with clean , heavy items ( books , large toys , canned goods , etc. ) or string to stabilize your fort .
#Text=Make sure you leave space for an entrance/exit and gaps between blankets for ventilation .
#Text=Adjust the distance between your chairs and the couch to be closer together to prevent the bed sheet from slipping .
#Text=Cover the floor of your fort with comfortable items to sit on .
#Text=Do n’t use the comforter from your bed , instead try layering the floor with sleeping bags , thick blankets , and pillows you do n’t mind getting dirty .
#Text=Divide areas in your fort with couch cushions to section off smaller rooms within your fort and add glow sticks or a flashlight for lighting .
#Text=Ask your child if they would like to bring their favorite toy or stuffed animal into the pillow fort as well .
#Text=Bean bags and air mattresses make for enjoyable seating .
#Text=Make sure your roof is high enough before attempting to include them to your fort .
#Text=Making Blueberry Muffins
#Text=Wash your hands with soap and water .
#Text=Be sure your child does too , then ask them to help prep the work space .
#Text=Clean off all surfaces with a sponge and hot , soapy water .
#Text=Preheat oven to 400 °F. Get out all ingredients and measure them .
#Text=Mix together flour , oatmeal , sugar , salt , and baking powder in a large bowl , then mix in blueberries .
#Text=Do n’t add more than the instructed amount of blueberries .
#Text=They might look sparse in the batter , but there will be plenty of blueberry in the muffins because blueberries bleed while baking .
#Text=Break the egg into another bowl and use a fork to beat it .
#Text=In the new bowl , add the milk and vegetable oil , then mix together .
#Text=Add this mixture to the mixture from step 2 in the large bowl .
#Text=Using a mixing spoon , gently stir all the ingredients together to avoid squishing the blueberries .
#Text=Your mixture should have lumps so do n't mix more than 25 to 30 stirs .
#Text=Spray a muffin tray with nonstick spray and spoon in the muffin mix .
#Text=Fill 12 muffin cups about two-thirds of the way up .
#Text=Clean excess muffin mix from spills on the tray .
#Text=Put the tray in the oven after it ’s finished preheating and bake for about 20 minutes .
#Text=When muffins are finished baking , remove from oven .
#Text=Allow muffins to cool about 5 minutes before transferring to a wire rack to cool completely .
#Text=Clean up after you ’re done .
#Text=After your snack is ready to go , put away all the unused ingredients in the fridge or cupboard .
#Text=Wash the muffin tray , mixing bowls , and mixing utensils .
#Text=Use a sponge with soap and hot water to wipe up crumbs and sticky spills on the counters .
#Text=Eat your blueberry muffins .
#Text=All your hard work will taste delicious !
#Text=Leftovers should be stored inside a container and kept in a pantry .
#Text=Doing Activities with Friends
#Text=Invite a friend of the child you are entertaining to come over .
#Text=Ask the child which of their friends they would like to have over , then call the chosen friend on the phone to invite them over .
#Text=Confirm the play date details with the friend ’s parent before having them over .
#Text=If you do n't have the friend ’s phone number beforehand , obtain it from the child ’s parent or a phonebook .
#Text=Play a game of Go Fish .
#Text=Sit together in a circle and shuffle a deck of cards .
#Text=Deal 7 cards to each player , then set the remainder of the deck face down in the center of the circle .
#Text=Each player should look at their cards , careful not to show any other players .
#Text=Then it is the player to the left of the dealer ’s turn to ask any player for a card with a value ( numbers , jack , queen , king or ace ) , which they must have in their hand while asking .
#Text=If the person asked has the card , they must hand it over to askee .
#Text=This makes a match and the askee can set down their two matching cards for points .
#Text=The askee receives another turn until asking a player for a card they do not have .
#Text=When the person asked does not have the card , they say “ Go Fish ” .
#Text=The askee ’s turn is over and they must pick a card from the center .
#Text=The player to the left of them now has a turn .
#Text=Continue taking turns until all cards run out .
#Text=The winner is the player with the most matches .
#Text=Example :
#Text=“ Adam , do you have any sevens ? ”
#Text=“ Go Fish ”
#Text=Watch a movie .
#Text=Bring a laptop inside the fort you made in part 1 and let the children choose a DVD or a movie from a streaming site rated PG or lower .
#Text=Make sure the children are comfortable and have enough blankets before playing the movie .
#Text=Provide them with water and leftover snacks from part 2 .
#Text=You can now relax , you have provided entertainment to last a child all day inside .
#Text=Things
#Text=You 'll Need
#Text=blankets
#Text=bedsheet , size queen or larger
#Text=two chairs
#Text=couch
#Text=cushions and/or pillows
#Text=nonstick spray
#Text=oven
#Text=mixing bowls
#Text=muffin tray
#Text=wire rack
#Text=mixing utensils
#Text=cleaning supplies
#Text=phone
#Text=card deck
#Text=laptop
#Text=movies
#Text=a friend
